name: Bahama Mama
instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a mixing tin. Add 5 ice cubes and shake for 5 seconds.
2. Strain into a Hurricane glass filled with crushed ice.
3. Garnish with tropical fruit.
description: Tiki master Paul McGee’s recalibrated version of this classic cocktail recipe involves dialing down the proportions and sweetness.

ingredients.name: Jamaican Rum
ingredients.description:
Jamaican rum refers to rum produced in Jamaica, a Caribbean island known for its rich history of rum production. Jamaican rum is renowned for its bold and distinctive flavor profile, often characterized by robust and complex notes.

Jamaican rum has a strong cultural and historical significance, and the island is home to several well-known distilleries, each with its unique approach to rum production. Brands such as Appleton Estate and Wray & Nephew are examples of Jamaican rums that have gained international acclaim.

ingredients.name: Overproof Rum
ingredients.description: Rum much higher than the standard 40% ABV (80 proof), with many as high as 75% (150 proof) to 80% (160 proof) available.
ingredients.note: preferably Rum-Bar Overproof White Jamaican Rum

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description: Pineapple juice is extracted by passing fresh, ripe pineapple through a juice extractor (juicer) or by muddling fresh cut pineapple chunks and then straining out the solids.

ingredients.name: Orange Curaçao
ingredients.description: Liqueur flavored with the dried peel of the bitter orange laraha, a citrus fruit grown on the Dutch island of Curaçao. Curaçao is used by liqueur makers overt the world as a generic name for orange-flavoured liqueurs.

ingredients.name: Crème de banane
ingredients.description: Perfectly ripened bananas are small-batch distilled to extract the rich banana flavor and natural amber color
